Cancer type considerations for COSMIC signature extraction

Source: vignettes/cosmic_cancer_type_note.Rmd
cosmic_cancer_type_note.Rmd

The trinuc_mutation_rates() function uses mutational signature extraction to calculate relative trinucleotide-specific SNV mutation rates in tumors. The “signatures_to_remove” option allows some signatures to be excluded from this analysis, which means each tumor will receive a weight of 0 for these signatures, indicating that none of the tumor’s SNVs are attributable to these signatures. This page describes the behavior of the helper function suggest_cosmic_signatures_to_remove() and the reasoning behind it.

In Alexandrov 2020, the developers of the COSMIC mutational signatures sets say that some signatures that do not appear in certain cancer types. Consider excluding some or all of these signatures in trinuc_mutation_rates().

There are also some signatures associated with various cancer treatments (SBS11, SBS31, SBS32, SBS35, SBS86, SBS87, SBS90), so you if you know that your sample is treatment-naive or hasn’t been exposed to the implicated drugs, some or all of these signatures can be excluded.

Note that while some COSMIC signatures are attributed to sequencing artifacts, you shouldn’t exclude these because cancereffectsizeR already handles these signatures specially.

The suggest_cosmic_signatures_to_remove() function will identify possible signature exclusions based on cancer type and treatment status.

  suggest_cosmic_signatures_to_remove(cancer_type = "BRCA", treatment_naive = TRUE)
  suggest_cosmic_signatures_to_remove(cancer_type = "Kidney-RCC")

The cancer type recommendations are based on Extended Data Figure 5 of Alexandrov 2020. The first two columns of the table below, also based on that figure, give the labels accepted by the cancer_type argument. (Note: SBS84 and SBS85 are absent from the Alexandrov figure, but they are elsewhere described in the paper as specific to lymphoid neoplasms.)

Before excluding signatures, make sure your data set does not contain tumors from multiple PCAWG categories. For example, TCGA HNSC (head and neck cancer) includes oral cancers, which are listed separately here as Oral-SCC, so excluding all signatures that do not appear in Head-SCC (such as SBS29, tobacco chewing) would not be appropriate.

PCAWG Applicable_TCGA Number_of_tumors Description
ALL (none) 33 acute lymphoblastic leukemia
Biliary-AdenoCA (none) 173 biliary adenocarcinoma
Bladder-TCC BLCA 369 bladder transitional cell carcinoma
Bone-Osteosarc (none) 36 sarcoma, bone
Bone-Other (none) 18 Paper vague; presumably bone cartilaginous neoplasm osteoblastoma, bone osteofibrous dysplasia, bone neoplasm epithelioid
Breast BRCA 834 breast adenocarcinoma, ductal carcinoma in situ, breast lobular carcinoma
Cervix CESC 204 cervical squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma
CNS-GBM GBM 100 CNS glioblastoma
CNS-LGG LGG 27 CNS lower-grade glioma
CNS-Medullo (none) 185 CNS medulloblastoma
CNS-Oligo (none) 18 CNS oligodenroglioma
CNS-PiloAstro (none) 48 CNS pilocytic astrocytoma
ColoRect-AdenoCA COAD, READ 719 colorectal adenocarcinoma
Eso-AdenoCA ESCA 347 esophagus adenocarcinoma
Eso-SCC ESCA 160 esophagus squamous cell carcinoma
Ewings (none) 85 Ewing’s sarcoma
Eye-Melanoma UVM 13 uveal melanoma
Head-SCC HNSC 313 head-and-neck squamous cell carcinoma (note HNSC also includes some Oral-SCC)
Kidney-ChRCC (none) 46 kidney chromophobe renal cell carcinoma
Kidney-Papillary KIRP 21 papillary renal cell carcinoma
Kidney-RCC KIRC 184 kidney renal cell carcinoma
Liver-HCC LIHC 489 liver hepatocellular carcinoma
Lung-AdenoCA LUAD 438 lung adenocarcinoma
Lung-SCC LUSC 350 lung squamous cell carcinoma
Lymph-BNHL (none) 135 lymphoid mature B-cell lymphoma
Lymph-CLL (none) 171 lymphoid chronic lymphocytic leukemia
Myeloid-AML LAML 106 acute myeloid leukemia
Myeloid-MDS/MPN (none) 43 myelodysplastic syndrome and myeloproliferative neoplasm
Oral-SCC (none) 52 oral squamous cell carcinoma (note some TCGA HNSC are oral)
Ovary-AdenoCA OV 149 ovary adenocarcinoma
Panc-AdenoCA PAAD 357 pancreatic adenocarcinoma
Panc-Endocrine (none) 95 pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor
Prost-AdenoCA PRAD 407 prostate adenocarcinoma
Sarcoma SARC 26 sarcoma
Sarcoma-bone (none) 59 paper unclear; perhaps osteosarcoma and other sarcomas combined?
Skin-BCC (none) 117 skin basal cell carcinoma
Skin-Melanoma SKCM 809 skin melanoma
Skin-SCC (none) 41 skin squamous cell carcinoma
SoftTissue-Leiomyo (none) 15 leiomyosarcoma soft tissue
SoftTissue-Liposarc (none) 19 liposarcoma soft tissue
Stomach-AdenoCA (none) 452 stomach adenocarcinoma
Thy-AdenoCA THCA 67 thyroid low-grade adenocarcinoma
Uterus-AdenoCA UCEC 291 uterus adenocarcinoma

COSMIC 3.1 Update

The new treament-associated signatures introduced in COSMIC 3.1 in July 2020 have been added to this page. Additionally, SBS88, associated with colibactin exposure, is not in the above table, but the COSMIC signature site says that it is found in head and neck, oral, urinary tract, and colorectal cancers.

Developed by Vincent L. Cannataro, Jeff Mandell.
